page.title: 08HOUSING
page.content:
{Eastwick
This is easily the smallest community of the three we examined. The 12th cen tury church stands to one side of the few houses which include a handful of semi-detached houses built after the Second World War. The old school, built in 1884, still stands but is now a garage. The finest house is a manor house built in 1826. The one public house is the Lion Inn built about 1850
{Roydon}
Roydon is much more of a village. It stands around the Village Green with the mediaeval church on the other side of the road. There are four public houses and a small number of shops.
